newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish shares plunge 3.98 pct, off lows.
newsitem.headline: Turkish shares plunge 3.98 pct, off lows.

text.p: Istanbul shares fell sharply on Tuesday in heavy selling triggered after morning reports that Japan's JCR agency downgraded its rating of Turkey's yen and euroyen bond issues to BB from BB+, brokers said.

The IMKB-100 closed down 3,311.41 points, or 3.98 percent at 79,861.38, but was firmer than an afternoon low of 79,131. Trade volume jumped to 28.21 trillion lira ($284 million) from Monday's 21.54 trillion ($217 million).
"The index rapidly fell below the 80,000 mark in heavy volume, but the market needs to confirm tomorrow that the 80,000 support has been broken," said Alp Tekince from Bumerang.
"The JCR report produced fluctuations in all markets although it was an expected development. The stock market's reaction was extreme due to heavy trade in a few shares," he said.
Several brokers expect the index to ease towards 75,000-76,000 range in coming days if it fails to recover to above the 80,000 support on Wednesday.
